intro: Hieraciodes ramosissima, commonly known as the stickyweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, often sticky leaves and stems, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or rocky areas. Hieraciodes ramosissima is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
